title: Tomatoes (Zone 7)
content:
**Planting Window:** April 10 - April 30 (Spring)
**Days to Harvest:** 70-90
**Spacing:** 3-5 ft apart

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Plant AFTER the soil hits 50°F (usually mid-April).
* Tomatoes stop setting fruit when night temps stay above 75°F (July/Aug).
* Watch for Hornworms in June.
* **Varieties:** Better Boy, Celebrity, Jet Star.

title: Cherry Tomatoes
content:
**Planting Window:** April 10 - April 30
**Days to Harvest:** 60-70
**Spacing:** 2-3 ft apart

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* More heat tolerant than large tomatoes.
* Indeterminate varieties grow HUGE - trellis well.
* **Varieties:** Super Sweet 100, Sungold.

title: Peppers (Bell)
content:
**Planting Window:** April 10 - April 30
**Days to Harvest:** 70-90
**Spacing:** 1.5-2 ft apart

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Needs consistent moisture to prevent blossom drop.
* Shade cloth in July/Aug helps prevent sunscald.
* **Varieties:** Keystone Resistant Giant, Jupiter.

title: Peppers (Hot)
content:
**Planting Window:** April 10 - May 15
**Days to Harvest:** 60-90
**Spacing:** 1.5 ft apart

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Thrives in OK heat.
* Reduce watering slightly as fruit matures to increase heat (capsaicin).
* **Varieties:** Jalapeno M, Tam Mild Jalapeno, Habanero.

title: Okra
content:
**Planting Window:** April 10 - May 30
**Days to Harvest:** 50-60
**Spacing:** 1.5 ft apart

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Soak seeds overnight to speed germination.
* Harvest pods when 3-4 inches long (every 2 days).
* **Varieties:** Clemson Spineless, Emerald.

title: Green Beans (Bush)
content:
**Planting Window:** April 10 - April 30
**Days to Harvest:** 50-60
**Spacing:** 3-4 inches

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Plant every 2 weeks for continuous harvest.
* Do not handle when wet.
* **Varieties:** Contender, Top Crop, Blue Lake 274.

title: Green Beans (Pole)
content:
**Planting Window:** April 10 - April 30
**Days to Harvest:** 60-70
**Spacing:** 6 inches

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Requires a strong trellis (6-8ft).
* Produces over a longer season than bush beans.
* **Varieties:** Kentucky Wonder.

title: Cucumbers (Slicing)
content:
**Planting Window:** April 10 - April 30
**Days to Harvest:** 55-65
**Spacing:** 1 ft (trellised)

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Bitterness is caused by heat/water stress.
* Trellis to keep fruit straight and clean.
* **Varieties:** Sweet Slice, Burpless.

title: Cucumbers (Pickling)
content:
**Planting Window:** April 10 - April 30
**Days to Harvest:** 50-60
**Spacing:** 1 ft (trellised)

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Harvest daily when small (2-4 inches).
* **Varieties:** National Pickling, Boston Pickling.

title: Squash (Zucchini)
content:
**Planting Window:** April 10 - April 30
**Days to Harvest:** 40-50
**Spacing:** 3-4 ft (hills)

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Watch for Squash Bugs and Vine Borers.
* Harvest when 6-8 inches long.
* **Varieties:** Black Beauty, Aristocrat.

title: Squash (Yellow)
content:
**Planting Window:** April 10 - April 30
**Days to Harvest:** 40-50
**Spacing:** 3-4 ft (hills)

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Harvest when skin is tender.
* **Varieties:** Early Prolific Straightneck.

title: Pumpkin
content:
**Planting Window:** June 15 - July 5 (for Halloween)
**Days to Harvest:** 90-110
**Spacing:** 5-6 ft

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Planting in June avoids the worst of the squash bugs.
* Needs lots of water.
* **Varieties:** Jack O'Lantern, Small Sugar.

title: Watermelon
content:
**Planting Window:** May 1 - May 20
**Days to Harvest:** 80-100
**Spacing:** 6-8 ft

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Needs sandy soil and heat.
* Harvest when the tendril nearest the fruit dries up.
* **Varieties:** Crimson Sweet, Sugar Baby.

title: Cantaloupe
content:
**Planting Window:** May 1 - May 20
**Days to Harvest:** 80-90
**Spacing:** 4-6 ft

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Harvest when the stem 'slips' (pulls away easily) from the fruit.
* **Varieties:** Hale's Best, Ambrosia.

title: Sweet Potato
content:
**Planting Window:** May 15 - June 10
**Days to Harvest:** 90-120
**Spacing:** 12 inches

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Plant slips, not seeds.
* Loves hot weather.
* **Varieties:** Beauregard.

title: Irish Potato
content:
**Planting Window:** Feb 15 - March 10
**Days to Harvest:** 90-120
**Spacing:** 1 ft

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Plant seed potatoes with eyes.
* Hill soil around stems.
* **Varieties:** Kennebec, Red Pontiac.

title: Onion
content:
**Planting Window:** Feb 15 - March 10
**Days to Harvest:** 100-120
**Spacing:** 4-6 inches

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Use 'Intermediate Day' varieties.
* Plant plants (transplants), not sets, for big onions.
* **Varieties:** Candy, Super Sweet.

title: Garlic
content:
**Planting Window:** Sept 15 - Oct 15
**Days to Harvest:** 240+
**Spacing:** 4-6 inches

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Plant cloves in Fall, harvest in Summer.
* Hardneck varieties produce scapes.
* **Varieties:** Music, German Red.

title: Carrots
content:
**Planting Window:** Feb 15 - March 10
**Days to Harvest:** 70-80
**Spacing:** 2-3 inches

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Soil must be loose and sandy.
* Keep surface moist for germination (cover with board).
* **Varieties:** Danvers, Nantes.

title: Beets
content:
**Planting Window:** Feb 15 - March 10
**Days to Harvest:** 50-60
**Spacing:** 3-4 inches

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Thinning is essential (seeds are clusters).
* Greens are edible.
* **Varieties:** Detroit Dark Red.

title: Radish
content:
**Planting Window:** Feb 15 - March 15
**Days to Harvest:** 25-30
**Spacing:** 1 inch

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Plant every 10 days for continuous supply.
* Gets woody/hot if left too long.
* **Varieties:** Cherry Belle, French Breakfast.

title: Spinach
content:
**Planting Window:** Feb 15 - March 10
**Days to Harvest:** 30-45
**Spacing:** 3 inches

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Bolts quickly in heat.
* Overwinters well if planted in Fall.
* **Varieties:** Bloomsdale Long Standing.

title: Lettuce (Leaf)
content:
**Planting Window:** Feb 15 - March 15
**Days to Harvest:** 40-50
**Spacing:** 4-6 inches

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Use shade cloth to extend season.
* Black Seeded Simpson is very reliable.
* **Varieties:** Black Seeded Simpson, Red Sails.

title: Kale
content:
**Planting Window:** Feb 15 - March 15
**Days to Harvest:** 50-60
**Spacing:** 1 ft

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Flavor improves after a frost.
* Very hardy.
* **Varieties:** Lacinato (Dino), Vates.

title: Asparagus
content:
**Planting Window:** Feb 15 - March 15
**Days to Harvest:** 2-3 Years
**Spacing:** 18 inches

**Oklahoma Tips:**
* Perennial crop (lasts 15+ years).
* Do not harvest the first year.
* **Varieties:** Jersey Knight, UC 157.

title: Peach (General)
content:
**Care:** Prune to open center (vase shape). Thin fruit to 6-8 inches apart.
**Pests:** Borers, Curculio.
**Oklahoma:** The quintessential OK fruit tree.

title: Peach (Elberta)
content:
**Variety:** Elberta
**Harvest:** Late July/August
**Notes:** Large, yellow-fleshed freestone. Old favorite for canning.

title: Apple (Gala)
content:
**Variety:** Gala
**Harvest:** August
**Notes:** Sweet, crisp. Does well in OK heat. Susceptible to Cedar Apple Rust.

title: Apple (Fuji)
content:
**Variety:** Fuji
**Harvest:** October
**Notes:** Very sweet, keeps well. Late ripener.

title: Pear (Bartlett)
content:
**Variety:** Bartlett
**Harvest:** August
**Notes:** Classic pear. Susceptible to Fire Blight (prune out infections immediately).

title: Pear (Asian)
content:
**Variety:** Asian (Hosui/Chojuro)
**Harvest:** August/Sept
**Notes:** Crisp like an apple. Very productive. Needs thinning.

title: Plum (Methley)
content:
**Variety:** Methley
**Harvest:** June
**Notes:** Self-fertile. Sweet, red flesh. Early ripener.

title: Cherry (Tart)
content:
**Variety:** Montmorency
**Harvest:** June
**Notes:** Best cherry for OK. Sweet cherries struggle here. Great for pies.

title: Fig (Brown Turkey)
content:
**Variety:** Brown Turkey
**Harvest:** July-Frost
**Notes:** Needs winter protection in Zone 7 (mulch heavily or wrap).

title: Persimmon (Native)
content:
**Variety:** American Persimmon
**Harvest:** Late Fall (after frost)
**Notes:** Very hardy. Astringent until fully soft/ripe.

title: Pecan
content:
**Variety:** Improved (Pawnee, Kanza)
**Harvest:** October/November
**Notes:** Oklahoma's state tree. Scab resistant varieties are best.

title: Blackberry
content:
**Variety:** Ouachita (Thornless)
**Harvest:** June
**Notes:** Erect canes. No trellis needed. Very productive.

title: Raspberry
content:
**Variety:** Heritage
**Harvest:** June & Sept
**Notes:** Struggles in OK heat. Mulch heavily and provide afternoon shade.

title: Strawberry
content:
**Variety:** Chandler, Sweet Charlie
**Harvest:** May
**Notes:** Plant in raised beds. Renovate beds after harvest.

title: Grape
content:
**Variety:** Mars (Seedless)
**Harvest:** August
**Notes:** Table grape. Disease resistant. Prune heavily in winter.

title: Bumblefoot
content:
**Symptoms:** Black scab on foot pad, limping.
**Treatment:** Soak in Epsom salts, remove scab (kernel), apply antibiotic, wrap.
**Prevention:** Smooth roosts, soft bedding.

title: Mites
content:
**Symptoms:** Dirty vent feathers, pale comb, reluctance to coop up.
**Treatment:** Elector PSP or Permethrin dust. Treat coop and birds.

title: Lice
content:
**Symptoms:** White egg clumps (nits) at base of feathers near vent.
**Treatment:** Permethrin dust/spray. Repeat in 7-10 days.

title: Coccidiosis
content:
**Symptoms:** Bloody poop, lethargy, ruffled feathers (chicks).
**Treatment:** Corid (Amprolium) in water for 5 days.

title: Egg Bound
content:
**Symptoms:** Penguin walking, straining, distress.
**Treatment:** Warm Epsom salt bath, calcium gluconate, lubricant.

title: Sour Crop
content:
**Symptoms:** Squishy, smelly crop.
**Treatment:** Withhold food/water for 12 hrs, then antifungal (Monistat/Nystatin).

title: Impacted Crop
content:
**Symptoms:** Hard crop that doesn't empty overnight.
**Treatment:** Oil massage, water. Surgery if severe.

title: Frostbite
content:
**Symptoms:** Black tips on comb/wattles.
**Prevention:** Low humidity in coop (ventilation!). Vaseline on combs.

title: Heat Stress
content:
**Symptoms:** Panting, wings out.
**Treatment:** Cool water, electrolytes, ice, shade, misters.

title: Molting
content:
**Info:** Annual feather loss (usually Fall). Hens stop laying.
**Care:** High protein feed (20%), minimize handling.

title: Broodiness
content:
**Info:** Hen sits on eggs and won't leave.
**Breaking:** 'Broody Jail' (wire cage, no bedding) for 3 days to cool belly.

title: Pasty Butt
content:
**Info:** Poop stuck to chick vent. Fatal if blocked.
**Treatment:** Warm wet cloth to clean. Apply oil.

title: Scaly Leg Mites
content:
**Symptoms:** Raised, crusty leg scales.
**Treatment:** Smother with Vaseline/oil daily for 2 weeks.

title: Wry Neck
content:
**Symptoms:** Twisted neck, looking up.
**Treatment:** Vitamin E + Selenium.

title: Predator Proofing
content:
**Predators:** Raccoons, Hawks, Coyotes.
**Tips:** Hardware cloth (not chicken wire), covered run, secure latches.
